Question
========

If you roll three pure dice there are 216 possible outcomes. Determine the event *A* if all three dice with a different number of pips come up. Then what is the complement of *A*, if $\bar{A}$?

Answerlist
----------

* $\bar{A}$ = {ten missing two dice have the same number of pips}
* $\bar{A}$ = {all 216 possibilities}
* $\bar{A}$ = {0}

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* $\bar{A}$ = {ten missed two dice have the same number of pips}: Correct
* $\bar{A}$ = {all 216 possibilities}: Incorrect
* $\bar{A}$ = {0}: Incorrect
